verses.verse: I have come<WH935> into my garden,<WH1588> my sister,<WH269> my bride.<WH3618> I have gathered<WH717> my myrrh<WH4753> with my spice;<WH1313> I have eaten<WH398> my honeycomb<WH3293> with my honey;<WH3293> I have drunk<WH8354> my wine<WH3196> with my milk.<WH2461> Friends Eat,<WH398> friends!<WH7453> Drink,<WH8354> yes,<WH7937> drink abundantly, beloved.<WH1730> Beloved

I was asleep,<WH3463> but my heart<WH3820> was awake.<WH5782> It is the voice<WH6963> of my beloved<WH1730> who knocks:<WH1849> "Open<WH6605> to me,<WH269> my sister, my love,<WH7474> my dove,<WH3123> my undefiled;<WH8535> for my head<WH7218> is filled<WH4390> with dew,<WH2919> and my hair<WH6977> with the dampness<WH7447> of the night.<WH3915>"
I have taken off<WH6584> my robe.<WH3801> Indeed,<WH349> must I put it on?<WH3847> I have washed<WH7364> my feet.<WH7272> Indeed,<WH349> must I soil them?<WH2936>
My beloved<WH1730> thrust his hand<WH3027> in<WH7971> through<WH4480> the latch<WH2356> opening.<WH4578> My heart pounded for him.<WH1993>

I rose up<WH6965> to open<WH6605> for my beloved.<WH1730> My hands<WH3027> dripped<WH5197> with myrrh,<WH4753> my fingers<WH676> with liquid<WH5674> myrrh,<WH4753> on the handles<WH3709> of the lock.<WH4514>

I opened<WH6605> to my beloved;<WH1730> but my beloved<WH1730> left;<WH5674> and had gone<WH5674> away.<WH5315> My heart went out<WH3318> when he spoke.<WH1696> I looked<WH1245> for him,<WH4672> but I didn't find him.<WH7121> I called him,<WH6030> but he didn't answer.

The watchmen<WH8104> who go about<WH5437> the city<WH5892> found<WH4672> me.<WH5221> They beat me.<WH6481> They bruised me.<WH8104> The keepers of the walls<WH2346> took my cloak<WH7289> away from me.<WH5375>
I adjure<WH7650> you,<WH1323> daughters of Jerusalem,<WH3389> If you find<WH4672> my beloved,<WH1730> that you tell<WH5046> him that I am faint<WH2470> with love.<WH160> Friends

How is your beloved<WH1730> better than another beloved,<WH1730> you fairest<WH3303> among women?<WH802> How is your beloved<WH1730> better than another beloved,<WH1730> that you<WH3602> do so adjure us?<WH7650> Beloved
My beloved<WH1730> is white<WH6703> and ruddy.<WH122> The best<WH1713> among ten thousand.<WH7233>
His head<WH7218> is like the purest<WH3800> gold.<WH6337> His hair<WH6977> is bushy,<WH8534> black<WH7838> as a raven.<WH6158>
His eyes<WH5869> are like doves<WH3123> beside the water<WH4325> brooks,<WH650> washed<WH7364> with milk,<WH2461> mounted like jewels.<WH3427>
His cheeks<WH3895> are like a bed<WH6170> of spices<WH1314> with towers of perfumes.<WH4840> <WH4026> His lips<WH8193> are like lilies,<WH7799> dropping<WH5197> liquid<WH5674> myrrh.<WH4753>
His hands<WH3027> are like rings<WH1550> of gold<WH2091> set<WH4390> with beryl.<WH8658> His body<WH4578> is like ivory<WH8127> work<WH6247> overlaid<WH5968> with sapphires.<WH5601>
His legs<WH7785> are like pillars<WH5982> of marble<WH8336> set<WH3245> on sockets<WH134> of fine gold.<WH6337> His appearance<WH4758> is like Lebanon,<WH3844> excellent<WH977> as the cedars.<WH730>
His mouth<WH2441> is sweetness;<WH4477> yes,<WH4261> he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved,<WH1730> and this is my friend,<WH7453> daughters<WH1323> of Jerusalem.<WH3389>
